author: Frontaly
title: Despedida del padre de la jurisdicción constitucional: Milton Ray Guevara | Acento
text: El fin de los doce años de la presidencia en el Tribunal Constitucional del Mgdo. emérito Milton Ray Guevara ha estado acompañado de un gran número de demostraciones de afecto y reconocimiento por parte de la población por una gestión que siempre puso primero a la Constitución. Estos reconocimientos no han sido un simple protocolo, sino una demostración genuina de cariño por parte de personas que deseamos honrar el esfuerzo incansable de un gran hombre de Estado en el establecimiento de una institución tan importante para nuestra democracia como el Tribunal Constitucional. Lo mismo debe decirse de los demás magistrados salientes, Mgdo. Díaz Filpo, Mgdo. Vásquez Sámuel, Mgdo. Castellanos Khoury y Mgdo. Castellanos Pizano, quienes también se dedicaron con mucha altura por más de una década por la causa de la justicia constitucional. Lo que se vivió el jueves 28 de diciembre de 2023 en los pasillos del tribunal es la prueba definitiva de que el Mgdo. Ray Guevara no fue solamente un gran magistrado, sino, sobre todo, un gran ser humano y caballero. Su salida de la institución no podía ser de otra forma: los servidores constitucionales colmaron los espacios comunes para aplaudir y despedirse de una persona que se dedicó en cuerpo y alma a la causa del constitucionalismo, sin permitir que su cargo le impidiera dejar de pisar sus pies sobre la tierra, tratando a todos por igual: magistrados/as, directores/as, letrados/as, secretarios/as, personal auxiliar, entre otros. Esos aplausos, y también las lágrimas de despedida, ponen en evidencia que el magistrado presidente emérito fue una persona muy querida, honrada y admirada, la cual merecía salir por la puerta grande. Algo puntual que siempre recordaré del magistrado es su capacidad para afrontar las disidencias, pues es sabido que las posiciones contrarias pueden traer diferencias importantes. Fue precisamente cuando teníamos posiciones jurídicas encontradas que conocí su grandeza. En esos momentos era que más elevaba su sentido de democracia, entendiendo mis razonamientos de derecho diferentes a los suyos, aunque no los compartiera. Esa es solo una de las maneras a través de las cuales supo preservar la sinergia y alcanzar consensos dentro de un pleno de jueces con pensamientos distintos. De manera que, por encima de las disidencias encontradas en nuestro rol como jueces, prevalecía la amistad. Por esta y muchas otras razones lo he llamado el “padre de la jurisdicción constitucional”, pues construyó a este tribunal desde la teoría y la práctica, desde la ciencia y el amor. El Mgdo. Ray Guevara puede tener la confianza de que, aunque su período de gestión concluyó, dejó a cientos de hijos e hijas que seguirán su legado en el Tribunal Constitucional, de la mano del mandato más puro de nuestra ley de leyes: proteger los derechos fundamentales de todos los dominicanos y todas las dominicanas, nuestra soberanía, nuestra nacionalidad y nuestra independencia. Ahora bien, esta despedida se hace más llevadera sabiendo que la Presidencia será asumida por un hombre de la talla del Mgdo. Napoleón Estévez Lavandier, quien ha mostrado un alto sentido de compromiso con la administración de la justicia. Tenemos en el nuevo magistrado presidente un digno sucesor, a quien acompañaremos en su trabajo con el gran propósito de cumplir y hacer cumplir con nuestra Constitución.

author: Get News
title: Embracing Evolution: Twenties Beauty Transitions From Traditional Wholesaler to a Dynamic E-Commerce Trailblazer | dailytimesleader.com | Serving West Point & Clay County Since 1867
text:
Twenties Beauty: Leading the E-Commerce Revolution.
Twenties Beauty, also called 20sbeauty , a pioneer in Korean skincare and makeup wholesale for over a decade, has boldly stepped into the spotlight of B2C e-commerce, setting the stage for a dynamic transformation in the industry. With a strategic shift from traditional wholesaling to a thriving online platform, Twenties Beauty has emerged as an e-commerce trailblazer, witnessing exponential growth in recent months.
Formerly known as Biolife Corporation, Twenties Beauty originated as a Southern California-based K-beauty wholesaler, catering to esteemed retailers such as Shibuyala and Palace Beauty. Leveraging a rich legacy of wholesale experience spanning ten years and a substantial six-year presence in e-commerce, the company has seamlessly transitioned into a formidable force in the online retail sphere.
The pivotal moment for Twenties Beauty arrived with its foray into TikTok Shop earlier this year, marking a significant turning point in its trajectory. This strategic move catapulted the brand's monthly sales to an impressive $700,000, underscoring its prominence as an e-commerce powerhouse. Embracing innovation, Twenties Beauty has recently ventured into the burgeoning realm of live-streaming commerce, witnessing promising initial outcomes.
"We pride ourselves on being e-commerce trailblazers, offering a comprehensive one-stop destination for Korean skincare and beauty products, coupled with expedited parcel delivery services across the United States," said a Twenties Beauty spokesperson. "Through diverse social media platforms like TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube, we endeavor to empower American consumers with skincare insights and access to effective products."
Recognizing the evolving consumer demands for expedited delivery and authentic Korean beauty products, Twenties Beauty embarked on its e-commerce journey. The brand identified a market gap, realizing the need for swift accessibility to K-beauty products without the prolonged shipping times typically associated with overseas suppliers. Thus, Twenties Beauty was born, starting with a small, dedicated team and gradually expanding its footprint.
Twenties Beauty boasts an extensive repertoire of trending Korean skincare and makeup brands, including Corsx , Round Lab, Beauty of Joseon , Mixsoon, Numbuzin, Skin1004 , Colorgram, and Bringgreen. Fostering strong partnerships with reputable Korean brand companies, Twenties Beauty strives to curate and deliver the most sought-after and efficacious products to its US clientele. As a testament to its credibility and rapport within the industry, Twenties Beauty proudly serves as the leading distributor for Anua products, exemplifying its commitment to showcasing premium-quality Korean beauty merchandise.
Customer Testimonials:
"As a K-beauty fanatic on TikTok, I rely on Twenties Beauty for my must-have products. Their selection and quick shipping keep me on top of the latest trends and skincare hacks to share with my followers!" - Emily.
"Discovering Twenties Beauty on TikTok was a game-changer! Their platform simplifies finding authentic K-beauty treasures, and their commitment to authentic Korean products is evident in every purchase. The quick shipping ensures I never wait long for my skincare favorite" – Sophia.
"I stumbled upon Twenties Beauty while searching for reputable K-beauty platforms. Their website is a goldmine for quality products. The expedited delivery has been a lifesaver, especially when I'm running low on essentials!" - Nora.
Conclusion:
With over a decade of experience as a wholesaler and a steadfast six-year presence in the online landscape, Twenties Beauty stands poised as a stalwart in the industry. Their unwavering commitment to expedited shipping underscores their dedication to customer satisfaction. Whether catering to beauty enthusiasts or individuals seeking premium skincare essentials, Twenties Beauty remains steadfast in its mission to cater to diverse beauty needs.
Please visit their official website below for more information about Twenties Beauty and its authentic Korean skincare and beauty products.
About Twenties Beauty:
Twenties Beauty, originating as a trusted K-beauty wholesaler in Southern California, has transformed into an e-commerce powerhouse, pioneering accessibility and authenticity in Korean skincare. With a decade-long legacy and a recent leap into online retail, the brand has swiftly responded to evolving consumer needs for prompt access to genuine K-beauty products. Beyond selling products, Twenties Beauty educates through TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube, empowering users with skincare knowledge and compelling product insights. This commitment to quality, expedited services, and educational initiatives cements Twenties Beauty's role as a leading force in the dynamic realm of beauty products.
Social Media:

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/official20sbeauty/
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@20sbeauty

author: D-Wave Quantum Inc.
title: D-Wave Quantum's Q3: 41% QCaaS Growth Despite Overall Revenue Decline | QBTS Stock News
text:
D-Wave Reports Third Quarter 2024 Results
D-Wave Quantum reported Q3 2024 financial results with mixed performance. QCaaS revenue grew 41% year-over-year to $1.6M, while total revenue decreased 27% to $1.9M due to lower professional services revenue. The company reported a net loss of $22.7M, up 41% from prior year. Year-to-date highlights include 11% revenue growth and 54% increase in GAAP gross profit.
Notable developments include NTT DOCOMO's planned production deployment for network optimization, completion of a 4,400-qubit Advantage2 processor calibration, and being deemed 'awardable' on the US Department of Defense's Tradewinds platform. The company maintains its fiscal 2024 guidance expecting Adjusted EBITDA Loss to be less than FY2023's $54.3M.
D-Wave Quantum ha riportato i risultati finanziari del terzo trimestre del 2024 con una performance mista. I ricavi da QCaaS sono aumentati del 41% rispetto all'anno precedente, raggiungendo 1,6 milioni di dollari, mentre i ricavi totali sono diminuiti del 27% a 1,9 milioni di dollari a causa di una riduzione dei ricavi dei servizi professionali. L'azienda ha registrato una perdita netta di 22,7 milioni di dollari, in aumento del 41% rispetto all'anno precedente. I risultati annuali includono una crescita dei ricavi dell'11% e un incremento del 54% del profitto lordo secondo i principi contabili GAAP.
Sviluppi notevoli includono il previsto dispiegamento della produzione da parte di NTT DOCOMO per l'ottimizzazione della rete, il completamento della calibrazione di un processore Advantage2 da 4.400 qubit, e la qualificazione come 'premiabile' sulla piattaforma Tradewinds del Dipartimento della Difesa degli Stati Uniti. L'azienda mantiene la sua previsione per il 2024, prevedendo che la perdita dell'EBITDA rettificata sarà inferiore ai 54,3 milioni di dollari del FY2023.
D-Wave Quantum reportó resultados financieros del tercer trimestre de 2024 con un rendimiento mixto. Los ingresos de QCaaS crecieron un 41% en comparación con el año anterior, alcanzando 1.6 millones de dólares, mientras que los ingresos totales disminuyeron un 27% a 1.9 millones de dólares debido a una menor facturación en servicios profesionales. La compañía reportó una pérdida neta de 22.7 millones de dólares, un aumento del 41% respecto al año anterior. Los aspectos destacados hasta la fecha incluyen un crecimiento del 11% en ingresos y un incremento del 54% en el beneficio bruto según los principios contables GAAP.
Los desarrollos notables incluyen el despliegue de producción planificado por NTT DOCOMO para la optimización de la red, la finalización de la calibración de un procesador Advantage2 de 4,400 qubits, y la consideración de ser 'premiable' en la plataforma Tradewinds del Departamento de Defensa de EE. UU. La compañía mantiene su guía fiscal para 2024, esperando que la pérdida de EBITDA ajustado sea inferior a los 54.3 millones de dólares del FY2023.
D-Wave Quantum는 2024년 3분기 재무 결과를 발표하며 혼합된 실적을 보였습니다. QCaaS 수익은 전년 대비 41% 증가하여 160만 달러에 달했고, 반면 총 수익은 전문 서비스 수익 감소로 인해 27% 감소하여 190만 달러에 머물렀습니다. 이 회사는 2270만 달러의 순손실을 기록했으며, 이는 전년 대비 41% 증가한 수치입니다. 올해의 주요 성과로는 11%의 수익 성장과 GAAP 기준 총이익의 54% 증가가 포함됩니다.
주목할 만한 개발 사항으로는 NTT DOCOMO의 네트워크 최적화를 위한 생산 배치 계획, 4400 큐빗 Advantage2 프로세서의 교정 완료, 그리고 미국 국방부의 Tradewinds 플랫폼에서 '수상 가능'으로 간주된 것이 있습니다. 회사는 2024 회계연도 가이드를 유지하며 조정된 EBITDA 손실이 FY2023의 5430만 달러보다 적을 것으로 예상하고 있습니다.
D-Wave Quantum a annoncé les résultats financiers du troisième trimestre 2024 avec des performances mitigées. Les revenus de QCaaS ont augmenté de 41 % par rapport à l'année précédente, atteignant 1,6 million de dollars, tandis que les revenus totaux ont diminué de 27 % à 1,9 million de dollars en raison d'une baisse des revenus des services professionnels. L'entreprise a enregistré une perte nette de 22,7 millions de dollars, soit une augmentation de 41 % par rapport à l'année précédente. Les points saillants de l'année à ce jour comprennent une croissance des revenus de 11 % et une augmentation de 54 % du bénéfice brut selon les normes GAAP.
Parmi les développements notables figurent le déploiement prévu de production de NTT DOCOMO pour l'optimisation du réseau, l'achèvement de la calibration d'un processeur Advantage2 de 4 400 qubits, et la qualification comme 'éligible à récompense' sur la plateforme Tradewinds du Ministère de la Défense des États-Unis. L'entreprise maintient ses prévisions pour l'exercice 2024, anticipant une perte d'EBITDA ajusté inférieure à celle de 54,3 millions de dollars pour l'exercice 2023.
D-Wave Quantum hat die finanziellen Ergebnisse für das dritte Quartal 2024 veröffentlicht, mit gemischter Leistung. Die QCaaS-Umsätze stiegen im Jahresvergleich um 41% auf 1,6 Millionen Dollar, während der Gesamtumsatz um 27% auf 1,9 Millionen Dollar zurückging, hauptsächlich aufgrund sinkender Umsätze im Bereich der professionellen Dienstleistungen. Das Unternehmen meldete einen Nettoverlust von 22,7 Millionen Dollar, was einem Anstieg von 41% im Vergleich zum Vorjahr entspricht. Zu den bisherigen Highlights des Jahres gehören ein Umsatzwachstum von 11% und ein Anstieg des Bruttogewinns nach GAAP um 54%.
Zu den bemerkenswerten Entwicklungen gehören die geplante Produktionsimplementierung von NTT DOCOMO zur Netzwerkoptimierung, der Abschluss der Kalibrierung eines 4.400-Qubit Advantage2-Prozessors und die Einstufung als 'auszeichnungswürdig' auf der Tradewinds-Plattform des US-Verteidigungsministeriums. Das Unternehmen hält an seiner Prognose für das Geschäftsjahr 2024 fest und erwartet, dass der bereinigte EBITDA-Verlust unter den 54,3 Millionen Dollar des Geschäftsjahres 2023 liegen wird.
- QCaaS revenue increased 41% YoY to $1.6M
- Year-to-date revenue up 11% to $6.5M
- Year-to-date GAAP gross profit increased 54% to $4.1M
- Government customer revenue increased 66%
- Research customer revenue grew 47%
- Customer base expanded to 132 from 125 year-over-year
- Total Q3 revenue decreased 27% YoY to $1.9M
- Net loss increased 41% YoY to $22.7M
- Professional services revenue declined 80% to $0.3M
- Commercial revenue decreased 4% YoY
- Bookings decreased 22% YoY to $2.3M
- Commercial revenue as percentage of total revenue decreased from 70.1% to 59.2%
Insights
D-Wave's Q3 results show mixed signals. While QCaaS revenue grew
Concerning metrics include increased net loss of
The strategic focus on government and research sectors is showing results, with government revenue up
Q3 QCaaS Revenue up
Fiscal YTD Revenue up
Fiscal YTD GAAP Gross Profit up
[D-Wave Quantum Inc.](https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dwavequantum.com%2F&esheet=54152719&newsitemid=20241114411241&lan=en-US&anchor=D-Wave+Quantum+Inc.&index=1&md5=1e8d4081212613af1dfa633f3c776ef2), (NYSE: QBTS) (“D-Wave” or the “Company”) a leader in commercial quantum computing systems, software, and services, today announced financial results for its third fiscal quarter ended September 30, 2024.
“Annealing quantum computing is continuing to drive the commercial adoption of quantum technology,” said Dr. Alan Baratz, CEO of D-Wave. “Organizations around the world – from Vinci Energies in
Recent Business and Technical Highlights
-
Announced that Japan’s largest mobile phone operator,
[NTT DOCOMO, is planning production deployment of a hybrid-quantum application](https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dwavesys.com%2Fcompany%2Fnewsroom%2Fpress-release%2Fntt-docomo-and-d-wave-improve-mobile-network-performance-by-15-with-quantum-optimization-technology%2F&esheet=54152719&newsitemid=20241114411241&lan=en-US&anchor=NTT+DOCOMO%2C+is+planning+production+deployment+of+a+hybrid-quantum+application&index=2&md5=5f2d3dd94d71c42481e16ee368d6f9f0), built with D-Wave technology, for optimizing mobile network performance. Using D-Wave’s annealing quantum computing solutions, DOCOMO found that it can reduce network signal congestion across base stations, potentially leading to more efficient signal transmission and equipment cost savings. -
Announced
[a new collaboration with Japan Tobacco Inc.](https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dwavesys.com%2Fcompany%2Fnewsroom%2Fpress-release%2Fjapan-tobacco-inc-and-d-wave-announce-collaboration-aimed-at-accelerating-innovative-drug-discovery-with-quantum-ai%2F&esheet=54152719&newsitemid=20241114411241&lan=en-US&anchor=a+new+collaboration+with+Japan+Tobacco+Inc.&index=3&md5=d5408f9e806171c0aeac16c919b8664c)(JT) to build a proof-of-concept that leverages quantum computing technology and artificial intelligence (AI) in the drug discovery process. The goal of the project is to pioneer a new process for discovering 'first-in-class' pharmaceutical small compounds. -
D-Wave has been
[deemed “awardable” on the US Department of Defense’s Tradewinds buying platform](https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dwavesys.com%2Fcompany%2Fnewsroom%2Fpress-release%2Fd-wave-deemed-awardable-vendor-for-us-department-of-defense-chief-digital-and-artificial-intelligence-office-s-tradewinds-solutions-marketplace%2F&esheet=54152719&newsitemid=20241114411241&lan=en-US&anchor=deemed+%<percent>26%</percent><percent>238220%</percent>3Bawardable%<percent>26%</percent><percent>238221%</percent>3B+on+the+US+Department+of+Defense%<percent>26%</percent><percent>238217%</percent>3Bs+Tradewinds+buying+platform&index=4&md5=238b442bdf8a275c5b165436e911341c), which is designed to accelerate the procurement and adoption of emerging technologies. The marketplace will now include D-Wave’s annealing quantum computing technology alongside other offerings like Artificial Intelligence (AI)/Machine Learning (ML), data, and analytics capabilities. -
Announced the
[completed calibration of a 4,400 qubit Advantage2 processor](https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dwavesys.com%2Fcompany%2Fnewsroom%2Fpress-release%2Fd-wave-achieves-significant-milestone-with-calibration-of-4-400-qubit-advantage2-processor%2F&esheet=54152719&newsitemid=20241114411241&lan=en-US&anchor=completed+calibration+of+a+<percent>4%</percent>2C400+qubit+Advantage2+processor&index=5&md5=92905a2c814534e5b415fc512b3a100c), marking a significant development milestone on the path to the commercial release of Advantage2. Compared to the previous Advantage2 prototype with 1,200 qubits, this increased scale features nearly 4x the number of qubits, allowing it to solve much larger problems. Performance benchmarks are consistent with the prototype released earlier this year, including doubled qubit coherence for faster time-to-solution, a40% increase in energy scale for higher-quality solutions, and increased qubit connectivity from 15-way to 20-way, enabling solutions to larger, more complex problems. -
[Introduced service-level agreements (SLAs)](https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dwavesys.com%2Fcompany%2Fnewsroom%2Fpress-release%2Fd-wave-introduces-service-level-agreements-for-leap-quantum-cloud-customers-in-production%2F&esheet=54152719&newsitemid=20241114411241&lan=en-US&anchor=Introduced+service-level+agreements+%28SLAs%29&index=6&md5=1c3cbd91dcf7e0c195b28e5e5e763ff8)specifically tailored for Leap™ quantum cloud service customers who are transitioning applications into production. D-Wave is the only quantum computing company providing formal SLAs, and, in doing so, stands behind the high levels of availability, reliability and performance of its Leap cloud service and its ability to support requirements for commercial-grade quantum and hybrid-quantum applications as customers move into production deployments. - Continued to make rapid progress on exploring generative AI architectures that directly use quantum processing unit (QPU) samples from quantum distributions to facilitate faster and more energy-efficient model training and inference. We have completed the initial designs of transformer and diffusion architectures and are moving toward benchmarking the role of the QPU. We are also directly supporting several customers investigating restricted Boltzmann machine architectures, a canonical machine learning approach for generative AI, that use samples from the QPU.
- Released new benchmarking vignettes showcasing the performance of the nonlinear hybrid quantum solver on two problems common to customers – flow shop scheduling/production scheduling and quadratic assignment/resource allocation. In addition, we improved the performance of the nonlinear hybrid quantum solver, solving a capacitated vehicle routing problem, for example, in one-fifth of the time.
- Continued to see expanding interest from national security and civilian agencies around near-term quantum applications, highlighted by a US Department of Defense RFI asking for near-term application identification, as well as increased discussions relating to optimization of emergency response, transportation and other public sector services in the US and abroad. This increased activity showcases governments' interest in better understanding how annealing quantum computing can play a pivotal role in solving public sector problems today.
-
Announced a
[strategic partnership with Staque](https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dwavesys.com%2Fcompany%2Fnewsroom%2Fpress-release%2Fd-wave-and-staque-announce-strategic-partnership-to-accelerate-annealing-quantum-computing-adoption-across-the-middle-east%2F&esheet=54152719&newsitemid=20241114411241&lan=en-US&anchor=strategic+partnership+with+Staque&index=7&md5=10477c5677b052a7a7fa15c8bf039f85), designed to accelerate the commercial adoption of annealing quantum computing across theMiddle East . The partnership was revealed at the first-ever QubitsUAE event inDubai , a half-day version of D-Wave’s annual Qubits user conference, which showcased “success powered by quantum” through business optimization use cases, progress in quantum-fueled AI technology, and demonstrations of annealing quantum computing performance over classical computing. -
Announced that D-Wave has
[joined the Chicago Quantum Exchange](https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dwavesys.com%2Fcompany%2Fnewsroom%2Fpress-release%2Fd-wave-quantum-joins-the-chicago-quantum-exchange%2F&esheet=54152719&newsitemid=20241114411241&lan=en-US&anchor=joined+the+Chicago+Quantum+Exchange&index=8&md5=c1ad5a2a191431fdcb40f3ea3be7290d)(CQE) as a corporate partner, aiming to engage with the CQE community on materials science research, quantum education, and the development of practical optimization use cases, including for the manufacturing and logistics industries. -
Continued ongoing progress executing the company’s aggressive go-to-market (GTM) growth strategy, most notably launching the quantum optimization market category with
[a robust collection of website content and assets](https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dwavesys.com%2Fsolutions-and-products%2Fquantum-optimization%2Fquantum-optimization-landing-page%2F&esheet=54152719&newsitemid=20241114411241&lan=en-US&anchor=a+robust+collection+of+website+content+and+assets&index=9&md5=0a1aa39d3d9b94e744d636b93081fd69)that showcase key use cases including workforce scheduling, vehicle routing, production scheduling, resource optimization, and cargo loading. In addition, recent work on our systems in the area of materials simulation has opened up new GTM efforts with research and government customers. -
Announced the expansion of the D-Wave executive leadership bench with
[the addition of Sophie Ames as chief human resources officer](https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dwavesys.com%2Fcompany%2Fnewsroom%2Fpress-release%2Fd-wave-expands-executive-leadership-bench-with-new-chief-human-resources-officer%2F&esheet=54152719&newsitemid=20241114411241&lan=en-US&anchor=the+addition+of+Sophie+Ames+as+chief+human+resources+officer&index=10&md5=5a60520bc616ff8a07ac4b133d08c45c)as well as the addition of two new board members, John DiLullo and Rohit Ghai. The moves are designed to help facilitate D-Wave’s next phase of growth as it continues to usher in the era of commercial quantum computing.
Third Quarter Fiscal 2024 Financial Highlights
-
Revenue: Revenue for the third quarter of fiscal 2024 was
, a decrease of$1.9 million , or$0.7 million 27% , from the fiscal 2023 third quarter revenue of .$2.6 million -
QCaaS revenue for the third quarter of fiscal 2024 was
, an increase of$1.6 million , or$0.5 million 41% , from the fiscal 2023 third quarter QCaaS revenue of , with the increase principally due to a higher average revenue per customer for D-Wave’s QCaaS subscription services.$1.1 million -
As a result of the timing of closing new professional services engagements, professional services revenue for the third quarter of fiscal 2024 was
, a decrease of$0.3 million , or$1.0 million 80% , from the fiscal 2023 third quarter professional services revenue of .$1.3 million
-
QCaaS revenue for the third quarter of fiscal 2024 was
-
Bookings1: Bookings for the third quarter of fiscal 2024 were
, a decrease of$2.3 million , or$0.6 million 22% from the fiscal 2023 third quarter Bookings of .$2.9 million -

-

, or$0.8 million 66% . -

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Feds threaten to limit public access to Maine fish hatchery after vandalism
text:
By Bill Trotter ,
24 minutes ago Public access to a federal fish hatchery in Orland might have to be restricted because of vandalism at the site, according to officials.
Craig Brook Fish Hatchery , which the U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service operates on Alamoosook Lake, is used for spawning and rearing protected Atlantic salmon that are stocked in seven rivers in Maine. It also has amenities on Alamoosook Lake and adjacent Craig Pond such as boat ramps, picnic areas and trails that are open to the public during daylight hours.
Recent vandalism has “made it a challenge to ensure these areas are safe and welcoming for the public,” hatchery officials said. The hatchery does not have staff or resources to monitor these areas, they said, and so is appealing to the public for help in keeping them clean, accessible and functional.
Up until 2020, access gates were locked each night at 8 p.m. to prevent campfires and vandalism, among other things, but the facilities have been more accessible since then.
“Since roads have been un-gated, there have been multiple instances of these prohibited activities, resulting in the need to close the bathhouses in favor of portable units,” hatchery officials said in a statement. “If these illegal activities continue, we will have to restrict or manage access to the public use areas of the station.”
Shannon Moss, spokesperson for Maine State Police, said troopers investigated a complaint at the hatchery this spring in which someone spray painted on stand-alone restrooms and outbuildings on the property.
“Given there were no cameras, no timeline, or idea from employees on who could have done this, there was little to go on,” Moss said. “The case is now closed.”
The federal agency might again start locking gates on the property at 8 p.m., service officials said. They urged anyone with information about the vandalism to contact the hatchery or the Hancock County Sheriff’s Office.
The federal agency did not respond to messages seeking additional information.
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

author: Jared Harris
title: China Rushes to Cover Up Humiliating Naval Loss, But Satellite Images Show They Weren't Quick Enough
text:
In my youth, I ordered a cheap inflatable canoe from China. The vessel’s maiden voyage ended in disaster just 50 yards from the shore, when the placid waters of the Little Maumelle River proved too much for the rapidly-deflating canoe.
While this inland naval disaster appears to be a problem with the quality of the country’s exports, recent events have shown that the Chinese People’s Liberation Army Navy suffers from similar sinking problems.
And Beijing didn’t lose an inflatable dinghy to Davy Jones’ Locker, but its newest nuclear-powered attack submarine.
Attempts to cover up the humiliating loss have now been exposed by satellite imagery.
According to the Wall Street Journal , a Zhou-class submarine, the first of its kind, sank at a shipyard near Wuhan. It’s believed the vessel sank in May or June.
The loss was not announced by the Chinese military or local officials, two groups that are still silent on the incident.
Former U.S. submarine officer Thomas Shugart appears to be one of the first to publicly post about something strange happening in the Yangtze River.
“I recently acquired some updated imagery from Wuchang Shipyard in Wuhan – China’s primary shipyard for non-nuclear submarine construction,” Shugart wrote on the social media platform X on July 16. “It appears there may have been something…odd going on there in June.”
Will the United States and China go to war? Yes No
Completing this poll entitles you to The Western Journal news updates free of charge via email. You may opt out at anytime. You also agree to our Privacy Policy and Terms of Use . Yes: 57% (161 Votes) No: 43% (123 Votes) Shugart noted the location was where he originally spotted a submarine, which he then identified through grainy satellite imagery as a potential diesel-electric Yuan-class vessel.
First, an older image from 29 May shows nothing unusual – a presumably new-construction Yuan-class submarine (Type 039 variant) in the usual spot where newly-launched boats are fitted out.
[BTW the patchwork nature of the images is because I buy my own and pay by the area, so..] pic.twitter.com/k8VJVVYkyX
— Tom Shugart (@tshugart3) July 16, 2024
He followed up the post with newer satellite images showing crane barges clustered around the location where the submarine had been. The floating pier now seemed to be moved aside, and Shugart noted something “roughly submarine-sized” that the cranes appeared to be working on.
Not satisfied with the clarity of that image, I waited a few days and got this one from 15 June, which is much better. It does appear that the crane barges were working on something black that is roughly submarine-sized and -shaped. pic.twitter.com/8viEexpPMd
— Tom Shugart (@tshugart3) July 16, 2024
United States government officials are unsure whether the submarine had nuclear fuel on board, but experts cited by the Wall Street Journal said it was likely.
Although the sub now appears to have been raised, Shugart told WSJ that the vessel is nowhere near seaworthy.
“The whole boat would be full of water. You’d have to clean out all the electronics. The electric motors may need to be replaced,” he said. “It would be a lot of work.”
Even a complete refit of the submarine would not address whatever originally caused the sinking.
Whereas a human error such as an open hatch could be an easy fix (by sending the offending sailor to one of China’s re-education camps , for instance), a technical or structural flaw may prove to be much more difficult to address.
The sinking is a major blow for the Chinese navy, which is expected to play a major part in a potential war over the communist superpower’s mortal enemy, the Taiwan-based Republic of China.
The island, just a stone’s throw away from the mainland People’s Republic of China, is a favorite target of Beijing, which considers it a rebellious and wayward province.
In the event of a war, United States forces are poised to help Taiwan’s defenders cast off any invaders who set foot on the island.

author: EDICIONES PLAZA, S.L.
title: Benidorm finaliza la instalación de sombras artificiales en las zonas de columpios del parque de Foietes - Alicanteplaza
text: BENIDORM. El Ayuntamiento de Benidorm, a través de la Concejalía de Parques y Jardines, ha finalizado la colocación de sombras artificiales en las zonas de columpios del parque de Foietes que comenzó el mes pasado y que permitirá que los más pequeños disfruten del parque con mejores condiciones de temperatura. En concreto, en este parque se han instalado 180 metros cuadrados de toldos en dos zonas de columpios que ahora estarán más protegidas del sol y las altas temperaturas. El concejal del área, José Ramón González de Zárate, ha indicado que esta actuación “se complementa con el contrato de arbolado para reforzar zonas que ya hemos estudiado” con el objetivo de que “la sombra de estos ejemplares permita una mejor estancia y baje la temperatura en las zonas de columpios”. González de Zárate ha aclarado que muchos lugares ya cuentan con sombras naturales “y allí donde no hay es donde actuamos con la instalación de estos toldos, que también logran el objetivo de hacer la zona más confortable”. La financiación de esta actuación se hace con cargo a la modificación presupuestaria aprobada el pasado mes de junio, “a la que se opuso el grupo socialista”, para aprovechar los remanentes de tesorería del último ejercicio económico. “El PSOE está en contra de que los más pequeños puedan disfrutar en los parques y los columpios porque siguen pensando que cuanto peor le vaya a la ciudad, mejor para ellos” ha afirmado González de Zárate. El edil ha añadido que en todos los barrios hay columpios y elementos biosaludables “para que pequeños y mayores puedan disfrutar de su ocio”, pero también ha puesto en valor las instalaciones de calistenia al aire libre que se han ido implementando para los jóvenes. “Casi todos los barrios de la ciudad tienen zonas de sombra naturales o artificiales. Se está haciendo un gran trabajo para que mayores, pequeños y jóvenes tengan ocio, hagan deporte y al final todo eso es salud para todos” ha apostillado el concejal. Esta intervención, que fue anunciada a finales del mes de agosto, ya es una realidad. Así, después de las actuaciones ejecutadas en Foietes, se hará lo propio en otros parques del término municipal. “Era algo que los usuarios nos habían venido reivindicando en varias ocasiones y mejorará las condiciones de uso de los parques, en especial las zonas de columpios en la que suelen jugar los más pequeños” ha afirmado González de Zárate, que también ha precisado que “preferimos que las zonas de sombra lo sean gracias a la vegetación natural y arbolado, pero hay veces en las que esto no es posible y de ahí que actuemos así colocando toldos”.
